code: @Manual{,   title = {SciDataReportR: Package for Generating Scientific Data Reports},   author = {Raha Dastgheyb},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 7.1.0, https://rdastgh1.github.io/SciDataReportR/},   url = {https://github.com/RDastgh1/SciDataReportR}, }

what: Package for Generating Scientific Data Reports
title: Package for Generating Scientific Data Reports
text: SciDataReportR combines custom wrappers new functions streamline scientific data reporting reproducible manner. goal allow easy EDA data analysis many combinations variables allow hypothesis generation hypothesis-driven analysis.

title: Package for Generating Scientific Data Reports
text: can install development version SciDataReportR GitHub :

what: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
title: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
text: function adds new variable entry existing codebook.

title: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
code: AddToCodebook(   CB,   VariableName,   VariableLabel = NA,   VariableType = NA,   VariableCategory = NA,   VariableRecode = NA,   VariableCode = NA,   VariableExclude = NA,   VariableNotes = NA )

title: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
text: CB data frame representing codebook. VariableName name variable. VariableLabel label variable (default: VariableName). VariableType type variable (e.g., numeric, categorical). VariableCategory category variable belongs. VariableRecode recode information variable. VariableCode code associated variable. VariableExclude flag indicating whether variable excluded. VariableNotes additional notes comments variable.

title: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
text: data frame representing updated codebook new variable added.

title: Add a new variable to a codebook — AddToCodebook
code: # Create an empty codebook codebook <- data.frame(Variable = character(0), Label = character(0),                        Type = character(0), Category = character(0),                        Recode = character(0), Code = character(0),                        Exclude = logical(0), Notes = character(0))  # Add a new variable to the codebook codebook <- AddToCodebook(codebook, "Age", "Age of participants", "numeric", "Demographics")

title: ConvertOrdinalToNumeric — ConvertOrdinalToNumeric
text: Convert ordinal variables dataframe numeric contain numeric values character representation.

title: ConvertOrdinalToNumeric — ConvertOrdinalToNumeric
text: Data dataframe containing variables. Variables character vector specifying names variables consider. NULL, columns dataframe considered.

title: ConvertOrdinalToNumeric — ConvertOrdinalToNumeric
text: dataframe ordinal variables potentially converted numeric.

title: CreateMCATable — CreateMCATable
text: function performs Multiple Correspondence Analysis (MCA) set categorical variables, imputes missing data needed, generates set visualizations tables interpret results.

title: CreateMCATable — CreateMCATable
code: CreateMCATable(   Data,   VarsToReduce,   VariableCategories = NULL,   minThresh = 75,   scale = TRUE,   center = TRUE,   Relabel = TRUE,   Ordinal = FALSE,   numComponents = NULL,   ImputeMissing = FALSE )

title: CreateMCATable — CreateMCATable
text: Data dataframe containing data analyzed. VarsToReduce vector column names Data included MCA. VariableCategories optional vector assign specific categories variables VarsToReduce. used color loadings plot. minThresh numeric value representing minimum cumulative variance threshold determine number components. Default 75%. scale Logical, indicating whether scale variables. Default TRUE. center Logical, indicating whether center variables. Default TRUE. Relabel Logical, TRUE, function replace missing labels data using external helper function ReplaceMissingLabels. Default TRUE. Ordinal Logical, TRUE, function treat variables ordinal MCA. Default FALSE. numComponents optional integer specifying number components retain. NULL, number components determined based minThresh. ImputeMissing Logical, TRUE, missing values imputed using missRanger. Default FALSE.

title: CreateMCATable — CreateMCATable
text: list following elements: p_scree ggplot object representing scree plot, showing cumulative percentage variance explained component. pcaresults MCA results object, includes component scores contributions. LoadingTable data frame variable loadings component. Scores data frame MCA scores individual data. CombinedData original data combined MCA scores. Lollipop ggplot object showing lollipop plot variable loadings across components.

what: Create PCA Table and Visualization — CreatePCATable
title: Create PCA Table and Visualization — CreatePCATable
text: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) specified variables create visualizations.

title: Create PCA Table and Visualization — CreatePCATable
code: CreatePCATable(   Data,   VarsToReduce,   VariableCategories = NULL,   minThresh = 0.85,   scale = TRUE,   center = TRUE,   Relabel = T,   Ordinal = FALSE,   numComponents = NULL )

title: Create PCA Table and Visualization — CreatePCATable
text: Data dataset containing variables PCA. VarsToReduce character vector specifying variables include PCA. VariableCategories, categorical, annotates lollipop plot color minThresh minimum threshold cumulative proportion variance (default 0.85). scale Logical, indicating whether scale data (default TRUE). center Logical, indicating whether center data (default TRUE). Relabel Optional argument relabel components. Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables handled. numComponents Number principal components compute.

title: Create PCA Table and Visualization — CreatePCATable
text: list containing PCA results visualizations.

title: Create Project Folder Structure — CreateProjectFolders
text: function creates project folder structure following directories: Data/ Raw/ Clean/ Scripts/ Reports/

title: Create Project Folder Structure — CreateProjectFolders
text: base_path character string specifying base directory folders created. Defaults current working directory.

title: Create Project Folder Structure — CreateProjectFolders
text: message indicating project structure created successfully.

title: Create Statistics Table — CreateStatisticsTable
text: Generate table statistics including means, standard deviations, counts, p-values.

title: Create Statistics Table — CreateStatisticsTable
text: Data data frame containing variables interest. TargetVar target variable statistics calculated.

title: Create Statistics Table — CreateStatisticsTable
text: formatted HTML table displaying statistics.

title: Create Summary Table — CreateSummaryTable
text: Generate descriptive summary table specified variables dataset.

title: Create Summary Table — CreateSummaryTable
text: Data dataset containing variables interest. Variables character vector specifying variables summary statistics calculated. numdecimals Number decimal places round summary statistics. Relabel Logical, indicating whether use variable labels column headers. Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables included summary. ScrollBoxHeight Height scroll box displaying table.

title: Create Summary Table — CreateSummaryTable
text: formatted HTML table displaying summary statistics.

what: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
title: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
text: function generates data frame summarizes types labels variables given data frame. optionally saves summary CSV file.

title: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
code: CreateVariableTypesTemplate(   DataFrame,   CSVFileName = NULL,   GuessCategorical = TRUE )

title: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
text: DataFrame data frame containing variables summarized. CSVFileName string specifying path name CSV file save summary. NULL (default), CSV file created. GuessCategorical logical variable specifying function guess variables categorical based <= 5 unique values

title: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
text: data frame following columns: Variable names variables input data frame. Label labels variables, available; otherwise, variable names. Type data types variables, converted user-friendly descriptions. Category placeholder column categorizing variables (default NA). Recode placeholder column recoding information (default NA). Code placeholder column code information (default NA). Notes placeholder column additional notes (default empty string). Exclude placeholder column exclusion flags (default NA).

title: Create a Template for Variable Types — CreateVariableTypesTemplate
code: df <- data.frame(   num = c(1.1, 2.2),   int = c(1L, 2L),   fact = factor(c("A", "B")),   char = c("a", "b"),   date = as.Date(c("2021-01-01", "2021-01-02")) ) CreateVariableTypesTemplate(df) #>      Variable Label        Type Category Recode Code Notes Exclude MissingCode #> num       num   num Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> int       int   int Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> fact     fact  fact Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> char     char  char Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> date     date  date Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             CreateVariableTypesTemplate(df, "variable_types.csv") #>      Variable Label        Type Category Recode Code Notes Exclude MissingCode #> num       num   num Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> int       int   int Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> fact     fact  fact Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> char     char  char Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA             #> date     date  date Categorical       NA     NA   NA            NA

what: Create a Z-Score Plot with Statistical Significance — CreateZScorePlot
title: Create a Z-Score Plot with Statistical Significance — CreateZScorePlot
text: function generates Z-score plot compare multiple variables across different groups. offers options parametric non-parametric tests, ordinal variable conversion, custom labeling. Significant p-values FDR-adjusted p-values highlighted plot.

title: Create a Z-Score Plot with Statistical Significance — CreateZScorePlot
code: CreateZScorePlot(   Data,   TargetVar,   Variables,   VariableCategories = NULL,   Relabel = TRUE,   sort = TRUE,   RemoveXAxisLabels = TRUE,   Ordinal = TRUE,   Parametric = TRUE,   SigP_YCoord = 1.5,   SigFDR_YCoord = 1.6 )

title: Create a Z-Score Plot with Statistical Significance — CreateZScorePlot
text: Data dataframe containing data analyzed. TargetVar string specifying column name grouping variable. Variables vector strings specifying column names variables analyzed. VariableCategories optional vector categorizing variables. Relabel Logical; TRUE, variables relabeled using labels dataframe. sort Logical; TRUE, variables sorted category p-value. RemoveXAxisLabels Logical; TRUE, X-axis labels removed. Ordinal Logical; TRUE, ordinal variables converted numeric. Parametric Logical; TRUE, parametric tests (t-test/ANOVA) used; otherwise, non-parametric tests (Wilcoxon/Kruskal-Wallis) used. SigP_YCoord Numeric; y-coordinate marking significant p-values. SigFDR_YCoord Numeric; y-coordinate marking significant FDR-adjusted p-values.

title: Create a Z-Score Plot with Statistical Significance — CreateZScorePlot
text: ggplot object representing Z-score plot.

what: Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
title: Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
text: function generates formatted data dictionary table using specified data frame. table includes variable names, labels, types, additional formatting based variable types.

title: Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
text: DataFrame data frame data dictionary created. numdecimals Number decimals display numeric variables (default: 2).

title: Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
text: formatted data dictionary table (gt object).

title: Create a formatted data dictionary table — FormattedDataDictionary
text: function requires gt package. installed, function return error.

what: Insert Values into a String Array — InsertValues
title: Insert Values into a String Array — InsertValues
text: function inserts one strings array strings specified locations.

title: Insert Values into a String Array — InsertValues
Insert Values into a String Array — InsertValues
text: vec character vector values inserted. values character vector single string insert original vector. after_value character string indicating element vec values inserted. length one location character string specifying whether insert values "" "" after_value. Defaults "".

title: Insert Values into a String Array — InsertValues
text: character vector values inserted.

what: Create Summary Table using gtsummary — MakeTable1
title: Create Summary Table using gtsummary — MakeTable1
text: function wrapper around gtsummary::tbl_summary ensures continuous variables treated continuous.

title: Create Summary Table using gtsummary — MakeTable1
code: MakeTable1(   DataFrame,   Variables = NULL,   TreatOrdinalAs = "Continuous",   AutoDetectDistribution = FALSE,   IncludeMissing = "ifany" )

title: Create Summary Table using gtsummary — MakeTable1
text: DataFrame dataframe create summary table . Variables Optional. character vector specifying names variables include summary table. NULL, variables included. TreatOrdinalAs Character. Specifies ordinal variables treated. Can "Continuous", "Categorical", "". AutoDetectDistribution Logical. TRUE, function attempt automatically detect distribution variables. Default FALSE. IncludeMissing Character matching gtsummary criteria. Can "", "ifany", "always". Default "ifany"

title: Create Summary Table using gtsummary — MakeTable1
text: summary table created using gtsummary.

what: Create a data dictionary for a data frame — Make_DataDictionary
title: Create a data dictionary for a data frame — Make_DataDictionary
text: function generates data dictionary given data frame, including variable names, labels, types, missing value statistics, summary statistics, relevant information.

title: Create a data dictionary for a data frame — Make_DataDictionary
Create a data dictionary for a data frame — Make_DataDictionary
text: DataFrame data frame data dictionary created. numdecimals Number decimals display numeric variables (default: 2).

title: Create a data dictionary for a data frame — Make_DataDictionary
text: data frame representing data dictionary.

what: Merge Two Data Frames by Closest Time — Merge_ByClosestTime
title: Merge Two Data Frames by Closest Time — Merge_ByClosestTime
text: function merges two data frames based closest time specified time columns. can also merge data frames using optional ID columns. resulting merged data frame contains closest time matches time differences.

title: Merge Two Data Frames by Closest Time — Merge_ByClosestTime
code: Merge_ByClosestTime(   DataFrame1,   DataFrame2,   TimeVar1,   TimeVar2,   IDVar1 = NULL,   IDVar2 = NULL,   is_date = FALSE )

title: Merge Two Data Frames by Closest Time — Merge_ByClosestTime
text: DataFrame1 data frame containing first set data. DataFrame2 data frame containing second set data. TimeVar1 name time variable DataFrame1 (string). TimeVar2 name time variable DataFrame2 (string). IDVar1 Optional. name ID variable DataFrame1 (string). provided, ID-based join performed. IDVar2 Optional. name ID variable DataFrame2 (string). provided, ID-based join performed. is_date Logical. Indicates whether time variables dates (TRUE) POSIXct timestamps (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Merge Two Data Frames by Closest Time — Merge_ByClosestTime
text: list containing two elements: merged_dataframe data frame closest time matches data frames time differences. time_differences numeric vector time differences closest match.

what: Plot and Summarize Group Statistics — Plot2GroupStats
title: Plot and Summarize Group Statistics — Plot2GroupStats
text: function creates plots summary tables compare two groups within dataset.

title: Plot and Summarize Group Statistics — Plot2GroupStats
code: Plot2GroupStats(   Data,   Variables,   VariableCategories = NULL,   impClust,   normalClust,   GroupVar )

title: Plot and Summarize Group Statistics — Plot2GroupStats
text: Data data frame containing data analyzed. Variables character vector variable names included analysis. VariableCategories data frame containing variable categories (optional). impClust character string representing important cluster. normalClust character string representing normal cluster. GroupVar grouping variable used comparison.

title: Plot and Summarize Group Statistics — Plot2GroupStats
text: list containing plot, summary table, p-value table.

title: Plot ANOVA Relationships Matrix — PlotAnovaRelationshipsMatrix
text: function plots relationship continuous categorical variables using ANOVA Kruskal-Wallis tests. generates "heatmap" points colored shaped based statistical significance effect size.

title: Plot ANOVA Relationships Matrix — PlotAnovaRelationshipsMatrix
code: PlotAnovaRelationshipsMatrix(   Data,   CatVars,   ContVars,   Covariates = NULL,   Relabel = TRUE,   Parametric = TRUE,   Ordinal = FALSE )

title: Plot ANOVA Relationships Matrix — PlotAnovaRelationshipsMatrix
text: Data data frame containing variables interest. CatVars Character vector categorical variable names. ContVars Character vector continuous variable names. Covariates Optional character vector covariate names ANCOVA analysis. Relabel Logical indicating whether relabel variables labels (default TRUE). Parametric Logical indicating whether use parametric (ANOVA) non-parametric (Kruskal-Wallis) tests (default TRUE). Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables considered.

title: Plot ANOVA Relationships Matrix — PlotAnovaRelationshipsMatrix
text: list containing three ggplot objects: p (scatter plot without multiple comparison correction), p_FDR (scatter plot FDR correction), pvaltable (data frame p-values significance).

title: Plot Associations — PlotAssociations
text: function generates scatter plots box plots visualize relationship two variables.

title: Plot Associations — PlotAssociations
text: DataFrame data frame containing variables interest. Var1 name first variable. Var2 name second variable. Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables included.

title: Plot Associations — PlotAssociations
text: ggplot object representing relationship variables.

title: Plot Bland-Altman Agreement Plot — PlotBlandAltman
text: Generates Bland-Altman plot visualize agreement two variables.

title: Plot Bland-Altman Agreement Plot — PlotBlandAltman
text: DataFrame data frame containing variables compare. Variable1 name first variable (string) compare. Variable2 name second variable (string) compare.

title: Plot Bland-Altman Agreement Plot — PlotBlandAltman
text: list containing: plot ggplot2 object Bland-Altman plot. stats list Bland-Altman statistics BlandAltmanLeh package.

title: Plot Bland-Altman Agreement Plot — PlotBlandAltman
text: function adapted code written Eran Shorer.

code: PlotCatInteractionEffectsMatrix(   Data,   xVars,   yVars = NULL,   xVarLabels = NULL,   yVarLabels = NULL,   interVar )

title: Plot Categorical Interaction Effects Matrix — PlotCatInteractionEffectsMatrix
text: Data dataset containing variables. xVars character vector names x-axis categorical variables. yVars character vector names y-axis categorical variables. Defaults NULL, case takes values xVars. xVarLabels character vector labels x-axis variables. Defaults NULL, case takes values xVars. yVarLabels character vector labels y-axis variables. Defaults NULL, case takes values yVars. interVar name interaction variable.

text: list containing matrices interaction coefficients, p-values, ggplot objects visualizations, tables FDR-corrected p-values.

Relabel Logical. TRUE, missing labels dataframe replaced column names labels plotting. Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables included.

title: Plot Correlations Heatmap — PlotCorrelationsHeatmap

text: Data dataset containing variables. xVars character vector names x-axis variables. yVars character vector names y-axis variables. Defaults NULL. covars character vector names covariate variables. Defaults NULL. method correlation method. Defaults "pearson". Relabel logical indicating whether relabel variables. Defaults TRUE. Ordinal Logical, indicating whether ordinal variables included. FS font size plot. Defaults 3.

what: This function creates directional heatmaps for the associations between continuous and binary variables. It identifies continuous and binary variables in the dataset and computes correlations using appropriate methods. — PlotDirectionalHeatmaps
title: This function creates directional heatmaps for the associations between continuous and binary variables. It identifies continuous and binary variables in the dataset and computes correlations using appropriate methods. — PlotDirectionalHeatmaps
text: function creates directional heatmaps associations continuous binary variables. identifies continuous binary variables dataset computes correlations using appropriate methods.

title: This function creates directional heatmaps for the associations between continuous and binary variables. It identifies continuous and binary variables in the dataset and computes correlations using appropriate methods. — PlotDirectionalHeatmaps
code: PlotDirectionalHeatmaps(   Data,   xVars = NULL,   yVars = NULL,   Relabel = TRUE,   Ordinal = TRUE )

title: This function creates directional heatmaps for the associations between continuous and binary variables. It identifies continuous and binary variables in the dataset and computes correlations using appropriate methods. — PlotDirectionalHeatmaps
text: Data dataframe containing data analyze. xVars vector variable names used x-axis. NULL, continuous binary variables included. yVars vector variable names used y-axis. NULL, defaults xVars. Relabel Logical. TRUE, variables relabeled better readability plots. Ordinal Logical. TRUE, treats binary variables ordinal certain calculations (future functionality).

title: This function creates directional heatmaps for the associations between continuous and binary variables. It identifies continuous and binary variables in the dataset and computes correlations using appropriate methods. — PlotDirectionalHeatmaps
text: list containing two plots (Unadjusted FDR Corrected), along corresponding data.

title: PlotInteractionEffectsContinuous — PlotInteractionEffectsContinuous
text: Data dataset analyzed interVar variable interest interaction effect xVars variables plotted x-axis yVars variables plotted y-axis covars Covariates included analysis Relabel logical value indicating whether relabel variables corresponding labels Ordinal logical value indicating whether variables ordinal

title: PlotMiningMatrix — PlotMiningMatrix
text: function generates matrix statistical relationships specified outcome predictor variables dataset. includes visualizations correlations, ANOVA results, FDR corrections.

title: PlotMiningMatrix — PlotMiningMatrix
code: PlotMiningMatrix(   Data,   OutcomeVars,   PredictorVars,   Covariates = NULL,   Relabel = TRUE,   Parametric = TRUE )

title: PlotMiningMatrix — PlotMiningMatrix
text: Data data frame containing dataset analyze. OutcomeVars vector outcome variables analyzed. PredictorVars vector predictor variables analyzed. Covariates optional vector covariates adjust analysis (default NULL). Relabel Logical flag indicating whether relabel variables output (default TRUE). Parametric Logical flag indicating whether use parametric methods (default TRUE). FALSE, non-parametric methods used.

title: PlotMiningMatrix — PlotMiningMatrix
text: list containing following elements: Unadjusted list unadjusted p-value table corresponding plot. FDRCorrected list FDR-adjusted p-value table corresponding plot. method method used correlation ("pearson" parametric, "spearman" non-parametric). Relabel value Relabel parameter. Covariates covariates used analysis, .

title: Plot Phi Heatmap — PlotPhiHeatmap
text: function generates heatmap Phi coefficient association binary variables provided dataset. Phi coefficient measures association two binary variables, function also performs chi-square tests pair variables.

title: Plot Phi Heatmap — PlotPhiHeatmap
code: PlotPhiHeatmap(   Data,   xVars = NULL,   yVars = NULL,   Relabel = TRUE,   Ordinal = TRUE )

title: Plot Phi Heatmap — PlotPhiHeatmap
text: Data dataframe containing variables interest. xVars vector variable names x-axis (predictor variables). yVars vector variable names y-axis (outcome variables). Relabel logical indicating whether relabel variables labels (default TRUE). Ordinal logical indicating whether consider ordinal variables determining binary variables (default TRUE).

title: Plot Phi Heatmap — PlotPhiHeatmap
text: list containing following components: Unadjusted list results containing Phi coefficients, p-values, number pairs variable combination. FDRCorrected list containing FDR-corrected p-values. method string indicating method used "Phi". Relabel relabel parameter. Covariates Currently set NULL, covariates implemented function.

Covariates vector column names representing covariates (optional). Relabel logical value indicating whether relabel variables using variable labels (default: TRUE). Ordinal logical value indicating whether treat ordinal variables numeric (default: TRUE).

title: Plot Point-Biserial Correlations Between Binary and Continuous Variables — PlotPointCorrelationsHeatmap
text: list containing two elements: Unadjusted: list unadjusted p-value table corresponding plot. FDRCorrected: list FDR-adjusted p-value table corresponding plot. method: statistical method used ("R_pb"). Relabel: Logical indicating whether relabeling applied. Covariates: covariates used.

VarTypes data frame containing information variables revalued. columns: Variable (variable names), Recode (yes/recoding), Code (revalue codes separated ","), Type (Categorical, Double, Ordinal), Label (optional label variable). missingVal value use missing values (default -999). splitchar character used split codes Code column (default ";").

title: Example Dataset: SampleVariableTypes — SampleVariableTypes
text: example modified VariableTypes file used Revalue SampleData.

title: Example Dataset: SampleVariableTypes — SampleVariableTypes
text: data frame 11 columns 138 rows: Variable Variable name, listed column name data file. Label Variable label, desired tables figures. Type variable treated, e.g., continuous (double) categorical. Category Optional future filtering: category type variable belongs . Recode 0 1, indicating whether variable recoded. Code variable recoded, recoded. Notes Optional notes variable. Exclude Optional filtering: whether variable excluded. Subcategory Optional additional categories variable. Include Optional filtering: whether variable included. MissingCode Optional: value considered NA.

title: Example Dataset: SampleVariableTypes — SampleVariableTypes
text: Exported CreateVariableTypes(SampleData, "SampleData.csv") modified Excel.

text: Data Dataframe containing variables OutcomeVars Character vector outcome variable names PredictorVars Character vector predictor variable names Covars Character vector covariate variable names (default: NULL) Standardize Logical indicating whether standardize numeric variables (default: FALSE)
